A **crossbow** is a type of [launcher](/wiki/Launcher "Launcher") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*. It is designed for [crossbow bolts](/wiki/Crossbow_bolt "Crossbow bolt"), and should be [wielded](/wiki/Wield "Wield") prior to [throwing](/wiki/Throw "Throw") or [firing](/wiki/Firing "Firing") them from your quiver, similar to a [bow](/wiki/Bow "Bow") and [arrows](/wiki/Arrow "Arrow"). Enchanting a crossbow only increases its to-hit rate, not its damage. Crossbows are made of [wood](/wiki/Wood "Wood").

## Generation

All [Gnomish](/wiki/Gnome_\(starting_race\) "Gnome (starting race)") [Rangers](/wiki/Ranger "Ranger") start the game with a +1 crossbow and stacks of +0 and +2 crossbow bolts, rather than a bow and arrows;[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)[\[2\]](#cite_note-2) crossbows and crossbow bolts are considered [racial equipment](/wiki/Racial_equipment "Racial equipment") for gnomes, though gnomish Rangers are the only case where this substitution applies.[\[3\]](#cite_note-3)

A [humanoid](/wiki/Humanoid "Humanoid") monster with a weapon attack, the ability to wield weapons and no other ruleset governing its [monster starting inventory](/wiki/Monster_starting_inventory "Monster starting inventory") has a chance of generating with a crossbow and a set of bolts, unless they are being generated on the [Rogue level](/wiki/Rogue_level "Rogue level"): the base odds are 1⁄14 for normal monsters, 1⁄12 for a monster that is a [lord](/wiki/M2_LORD "M2 LORD") or [nasty](/wiki/Nasty "Nasty"), 1⁄10 for a monster that is an [overlord](/wiki/M2_PRINCE "M2 PRINCE") or both a lord and nasty, and 1⁄8 for a monster that is both nasty and an overlord.[\[4\]](#cite_note-4)

[Plains centaurs](/wiki/Plains_centaur "Plains centaur") and [mountain centaurs](/wiki/Mountain_centaur "Mountain centaur") have a 1⁄2 chance of [generating with](/wiki/Monster_starting_inventory "Monster starting inventory") a crossbow and 3–14 bolts.[\[5\]](#cite_note-5)

## Crossbow skill

| Crossbow |                                                                                                  |
| -------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ |
| Max      | [Role](/wiki/Role "Role")                                                                        |
| Basic    | - [Monk](/wiki/Monk "Monk"), [Priest](/wiki/Priest "Priest"), [Tourist](/wiki/Tourist "Tourist") |
| Skilled  | * [Knight](/wiki/Knight "Knight")                                                                |
| Expert   | - [Rogue](/wiki/Rogue "Rogue"), [Ranger](/wiki/Ranger "Ranger")                                  |

The crossbow is the only launcher to use crossbow skill, and [crossbow bolts](/wiki/Crossbow_bolt "Crossbow bolt") are the only ammo to use this launcher. There are no [artifact](/wiki/Artifact_weapon "Artifact weapon") crossbows.

## Description

Crossbows always fire at their maximum range of 8 squares, rather than basing their range on [strength](/wiki/Strength "Strength") as other [missile](/wiki/Missile "Missile") weapons do. Instead, crossbows apply a [multishot](/wiki/Multishot "Multishot") penalty if their user is below a certain strength threshold: gnomes must have at least 16 strength to obtain full multishot bonuses, while other races require 18 strength. Gnomes other than [Healers](/wiki/Healer "Healer") and [Wizards](/wiki/Wizard "Wizard") also gain a +1 multishot racial bonus when firing bolts from a crossbow.

## Strategy

High-strength characters lacking a ranged weapon may choose to retrieve a crossbow from the [Gnomish Mines](/wiki/Gnomish_Mines "Gnomish Mines"); ammo for the crossbow is somewhat scarce compared to arrows, which are much more commonplace due to the various arrow types and [arrow traps](/wiki/Arrow_trap "Arrow trap"). As with most launchers, you should [enchant](/wiki/Scroll_of_enchant_weapon "Scroll of enchant weapon") the bolts themselves (rather than the crossbow) in order to increase their damage; crossbow enchantment only affects their to-hit rate.

[Monks](/wiki/Monk "Monk") looking to maintain [weaponless](/wiki/Weaponless "Weaponless") conduct may elect to carry a crossbow and bolts on hand; Rogues can also get Expert in crossbow, making them an option for their long-term ranged weapon.

Gnomish Rangers may get additional crossbow bolts in the early game from [gnomes](/wiki/Gnome_\(monster_class\) "Gnome (monster class)"), but may want to let a [pet](/wiki/Pet "Pet") do the killing to avoid [alignment record](/wiki/Alignment_record "Alignment record") penalties. The centaurs in the [Ranger quest](/wiki/Ranger_quest "Ranger quest") provide a plentiful source during the midgame, but attack [wands](/wiki/Wand "Wand") may be a problem without [reflection](/wiki/Reflection "Reflection") or the relevant resistances. Their [quest artifact](/wiki/Quest_artifact "Quest artifact"), [The Longbow of Diana](/wiki/The_Longbow_of_Diana "The Longbow of Diana"), uses a different skill and ammunition that is incompatible with crossbows; a gnomish Ranger may prefer to keep their crossbow and a large stack of enchanted crossbow bolts as their primary ranged attack, and carry the Longbow only for the extrinsic [telepathy](/wiki/Telepathy "Telepathy").

## History

Crossbows and their ammo first appear in Hack 1.21 and Hack for PDP-11, which are based on [Jay Fenlason's Hack](/wiki/Jay_Fenlason%27s_Hack "Jay Fenlason's Hack"), and is included in the initial weapon list for [Hack 1.0](/wiki/Hack_1.0 "Hack 1.0"). Their special behaviors with regards to range and multishot are introduced in [NetHack 3.6.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.6.0 "NetHack 3.6.0").

## Variants

### SLASH'EM

In [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), crossbows are [two-handed](/wiki/Two-handed "Two-handed") weapons. SLASH'EM also introduces an artifact crossbow, [Hellfire](/wiki/Hellfire "Hellfire"), that is [chaotic](/wiki/Chaotic "Chaotic")-aligned and provides [fire resistance](/wiki/Fire_resistance "Fire resistance") when wielded; bolts fired from it that hit monsters create a fiery explosion in a 3x3 square centered on that monster.

[Undead Slayers](/wiki/Undead_Slayer "Undead Slayer") have a chance of starting the game with a crossbow and bolts.

### GruntHack

In [GruntHack](/wiki/GruntHack "GruntHack"), crossbows now fire a set range regardless of strength, and require high strength to fire multiple shots.

### dNetHack

[dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack") and [notdNetHack](/wiki/NotdNetHack "NotdNetHack") add the [droven crossbow](/wiki/Droven_crossbow "Droven crossbow") as a weapon that uses the crossbow skill.

All gnomish characters in roles that start with a bow and arrows are given a crossbow and bolts, and all gnomes get an extra die of weapon damage when firing bolts from crossbows - they can also reach Expert skill in crossbow.

[Astaroth](/wiki/Astaroth "Astaroth") is a [spirit](/wiki/Spirits_\(dNetHack\) "Spirits (dNetHack)") that grants skill in crossbows while bound.

Each shot from a crossbow applies a 3x damage bonus based on current skill level: -5 at Restricted, -2 at Unskilled, +0 at Basic, +2 at Skilled and +5 at Expert. Higher skill levels also apply damage increases for each fired bolt instead of multishot:

- Basic or lower: 1x(bolt+enchantment) damage
- Skilled: 2x(bolt+enchantment) damage
- Expert: 3x(bolt+enchantment) damage

The extra damage is precision-based and does not apply against monsters that are amorphous or stationary, or ones that are incorporeal (as they are assumed to lack discernible weak-points).

There are three artifact crossbows:

- [The Rogue Gear-Spirits](/wiki/The_Rogue_Gear-Spirits "The Rogue Gear-Spirits"), which replaces The Longbow of Diana as the [quest artifact](/wiki/Quest_artifact "Quest artifact") for the [Gnomish Ranger Quest](/wiki/Gnomish_Ranger_Quest "Gnomish Ranger Quest").
- [Hellfire](/wiki/Hellfire_\(dNetHack\) "Hellfire (dNetHack)"), which is similar to its SLASH'EM incarnation and grants fire resistance alongside firing explosive bolts.
- [The Unstoppable](/wiki/DNetHack_artifacts#The_Unstoppable "DNetHack artifacts"), which causes fired bolts to pierce through hostile monsters on hit, and bolts that miss will continue flying until they hit a wall.

### NetHack Fourk

In [NetHack Fourk](/wiki/NetHack_Fourk "NetHack Fourk"), gnomes have increased skill caps for crossbows.

### SpliceHack

In [SpliceHack](/wiki/SpliceHack "SpliceHack"), [merfolk](/wiki/Merfolk_\(starting_race\) "Merfolk (starting race)") characters in roles that would start the game with a bow and arrows receive a crossbow and bolts instead.

### EvilHack

In [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack"), Monks no longer have the crossbow skill available; [centaurs](/wiki/Centaur_\(starting_race\) "Centaur (starting race)") gain a +1 multishot bonus when using crossbows. This means that centaur Monks can still fire 2 crossbow bolts per shot despite the skill being restricted.

Gnomish Rangers have their quest artifact changed to [The Crossbow of Carl](/wiki/The_Crossbow_of_Carl "The Crossbow of Carl"), which is an artifact crossbow that mirrors The Longbow of Diana given to other Rangers. This allows them to preserve their multishot bonuses while also giving access to an unlimited source of crossbow bolts.

### SlashTHEM

In [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM"), in addition to SLASH'EM details, [Warriors](/wiki/Warrior "Warrior") start each game with a +1 crossbow and a stack of +0 crossbow bolts; Undead Slayers now have a 1⁄2 chance of start with a crossbow and some bolts. All player gnomes are capable of reaching skilled in crossbows.

[Player monster](/wiki/Player_monster "Player monster") undead slayers and gnomish non-[Cavemen](/wiki/Cavemen "Cavemen") are likely to generate with a crossbow and some bolts.

## Encyclopaedia entry

"God save thee, ancient Mariner!  
From the fiends, that plague thee thus! -  
Why look'st thou so?" - With my cross-bow  
I shot the Albatross.

\[ The Rime of the Ancient Mariner, by Samuel Taylor  
           Coleridge ]

===SpliceHack===
In [[SpliceHack]], [[merfolk (starting race)|merfolk]] characters in roles that would start the game with a bow and arrows receive a crossbow and bolts instead.

===EvilHack===
In [[EvilHack]], Monks no longer have the crossbow skill available; [[Centaur (starting race)|centaurs]] gain a +1 multishot bonus when using crossbows. This means that centaur Monks can still fire 2 crossbow bolts per shot despite the skill being restricted.

Gnomish Rangers have their quest artifact changed to [[The Crossbow of Carl]], which is an artifact crossbow that mirrors The Longbow of Diana given to other Rangers. This allows them to preserve their multishot bonuses while also giving access to an unlimited source of crossbow bolts.

===SlashTHEM===
In [[SlashTHEM]], in addition to SLASH'EM details, [[Warrior]]s start each game with a +1 crossbow and a stack of +0 crossbow bolts; Undead Slayers now have a {{frac|2}} chance of start with a crossbow and some bolts. All player gnomes are capable of reaching skilled in crossbows.

[[Player monster]] undead slayers and gnomish non-[[Cavemen]] are likely to generate with a crossbow and some bolts.
